personal_info.name: Andrew Cabrera
personal_info.summary: Software Engineer with over 8 years in software development, open-source contributions, and tech leadership. Expertise in full-stack and mobile development, DevOps, and artificial intelligence. Currently focused on building innovative solutions in the tech industry and looking for new roles.

description: Developed and maintained web applications using React, Node.js, and GraphQL
Designed and implemented RESTful APIs and microservices
Worked with cloud platforms like AWS and GCP for deployment and scaling
Utilized Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration
Spearheaded projects in machine learning and AI, including image recognition and natural language processing
Contributed to open-source projects and communities, focusing on accessibility and educational resources
Collaborated with clients to gather requirements and deliver high-quality software solutions
Implemented CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions and Docker
Worked on various projects including e-commerce platforms, educational tools, and mobile applications
Maintained network security and data privacy standards with encryption and secure coding practices for customer data with regards to HIPAA and GDPR compliance
Branched out into game development, creating AR/VR applications using Unity and Unreal Engine
Developed a personal portfolio website showcasing projects and skills
Maintained bi-weekly/weekly sprints for two teams
Redesigned WSJ and Barron's iOS apps
Developed real-time election alert system
Architected Slingshot API tool for editorial data conversion
Implemented SAML/Single Sign-On authentication
Reduced crashes via XCode Server build system
Migrated Objective-C codebase to Swift
Developed Slack health monitoring bot
Created automated deployment tools with Grunt
Led diversity workshops for underrepresented groups in the NYC tech community
Mentored students in software development and career readiness
Developed a web application for NYC schools to track student progress
Created a mobile app for students to access educational resources
Collaborated with city officials and companies on tech initiatives
Participated in hackathons and tech events with companies such as Google, Facebook, and Microsoft
Diagnosed and repaired Apple products
Performed BGA/SMD soldering
Trained new employees on service processes

open_source.description: Contributed to open-source projects during medical leave, focusing on accessibility, community-driven development, and educational resources.

awards.Philadelphia Tech Week: Best in Show award for AR app
